newsitem.title: UK: Med oil products mixed, markets fairly quiet.
newsitem.headline: Med oil products mixed, markets fairly quiet.

text.p: Mediterranean oil products were mixed on Friday, traders said.
Petrogal said its Sines refinery would shut down for maintenance from September 11 to October 21.
Gasoline prices remained easy with stocks still looking generally long despite lower production levels as refiners miximise on more profitable distillate production.
Traders said the market was underpinned by stronger crude, but lengthy supplies and poor demand, kept sentiment bearish.
Naphtha talked steady in quiet trade supported by crude and with sellers levels holdings stable amid limited avails.
A trader was heard offering a late September loading Algerian cargo at a steady $205 cif Med.

Low sulphur fuel oil was weaker. A large Italian end user bought a 30,000 tonne cargo loading in Antwerp next week at $106 fob ARA. This deal surprised many traders, who saw a high sulphur cargo sold to a trader, who needs to cover commitments into the latest Portuguese tender, out of ARA at $109 fob NWE.
The trader was heard now holding at least five cargoes for the tender, and was thought to need between one and three more.
The trader was heard having bought an Italian cargo on Thursday but the price was not known.
Another dealer, who bought a mid-month Italian cargo last week at fob high +$1.25, was heard having sold it at +$1.50.
A further trader was offered a 50,000 tonne low sulphur cargo, Oct arrival, at $117 cif Italy.
Gas oil was firm, but high prices subdued the market.
Two Russian cargoes were on offer. Premiums were put at quotes cif high +$2.0/+$2.50. Turkish and Greek demand was seen lending support to 0.2 percent material.
French refiners were also reported to be looking for FOD cargoes to the Med, although no deals are reported.
